2544 * modify the forward record (A or AAAA) and calls one of a set of
2545 * routines to build the specific message.
2546 */
2547
2548isc_result_t
2549ddns_modify_fwd(dhcp_ddns_cb_t *ddns_cb, const char *file, int line)
2550{
2551 isc_result_t result;
2552 dns_tsec_t *tsec_key = NULL;
2553
2554#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
2555 log_info("DDNS: ddns_modify_fwd");
2556#endif
2557
2558 unsigned char *clientname;
2559 dhcp_ddns_data_t *dataspace = NULL;
2560 dns_namelist_t prereqlist, updatelist;
2561 dns_fixedname_t zname0, pname0, uname0;
2562 dns_name_t *zname = NULL, *pname, *uname;
2563
2564 isc_sockaddrlist_t *zlist = NULL;
2565
2566 /* Creates client context if we need to */
2567 result = dns_client_init();
2568 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2569 return result;
2570 }
2571
2572 /* Get a pointer to the clientname to make things easier. */
2573 clientname = (unsigned char *)ddns_cb->fwd_name.data;
2574
2575 /* Extract and validate the type of the address. */
2576 if (ddns_cb->address.len == 4) {
2577 ddns_cb->address_type = dns_rdatatype_a;
2578 } else if (ddns_cb->address.len == 16) {
2579 ddns_cb->address_type = dns_rdatatype_aaaa;
2580 } else {
2581 return DHCP_R_INVALIDARG;
2582 }
2583
2584 /*
2585 * If we already have a zone use it, otherwise try to lookup the
2586 * zone in our cache. If we find one we will have a pointer to
2587 * the zone that needs to be dereferenced when we are done with it.
2588 * If we don't find one that is okay we'll let the DNS code try and
2589 * find the information for us.
2590 */
2591
2592 if (ddns_cb->zone == NULL) {
2593 result = find_cached_zone(ddns_cb, FIND_FORWARD);
2594#if defined (DNS_ZONE_LOOKUP)
2595 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND) {
2596 /*
2597 * We didn't find a cached zone, see if we can
2598 * can find a nameserver and create a zone.
2599 */
2600 if (find_zone_start(ddns_cb, FIND_FORWARD)
2601 == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2602 /*
2603 * We have started the process to find a zone
2604 * queue the ddns_cb for processing after we
2605 * create the zone
2606 */
2607 /* sar - not yet implemented, currently we just
2608 * arrange for things to get cleaned up
2609 */
2610 goto cleanup;
2611 }
2612 }
2613#endif
2614 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2615 goto cleanup;
2616 }
2617
2618 /*
2619 * If we have a zone try to get any information we need
2620 * from it - name, addresses and the key. The address
2621 * and key may be empty the name can't be.
2622 */
2623 if (ddns_cb->zone) {
2624 /* Set up the zone name for use by DNS */
2625 result = dhcp_isc_name(ddns_cb->zone_name, &zname0, &zname);
2626 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2627 log_error("Unable to build name for zone for "
2628 "fwd update: %s %s",
2629 ddns_cb->zone_name,
2630 isc_result_totext(result));
2631 goto cleanup;
2632 }
2633
2634 if (!(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(ddns_cb->zone_server_list))) {
2635 /* If we have any addresses get them */
2636 zlist = &ddns_cb->zone_server_list;
2637 }
2638
2639
2640 if (ddns_cb->zone->key != NULL) {
2641 /*
2642 * Not having a key is fine, having a key
2643 * but not a tsec is odd so we warn the user.
2644 */
2645 /*sar*/
2646 /* should we do the warning? */
2647 tsec_key = ddns_cb->zone->key->tsec_key;
2648 if (tsec_key == NULL) {
2649 log_error("No tsec for use with key %s",
2650 ddns_cb->zone->key->name);
2651 }
2652 }
2653 }
2654
2655 /* Set up the DNS names for the prereq and update lists */
2656 if (((result = dhcp_isc_name(clientname, &pname0, &pname))
2657 != ISC_R_SUCCESS) ||
2658 ((result = dhcp_isc_name(clientname, &uname0, &uname))
2659 != ISC_R_SUCCESS)) {
2660 log_error("Unable to build name for fwd update: %s %s",
2661 clientname, isc_result_totext(result));
2662 goto cleanup;
2663 }
2664
2665 /* Allocate the various isc dns library structures we may require. */
2666 dataspace = isc_mem_get(dhcp_gbl_ctx.mctx, sizeof(*dataspace) * 4);
2667 if (dataspace == NULL) {
2668 log_error("Unable to allocate memory for fwd update");
2669 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
2670 goto cleanup;
2671 }
2672
2673 ISC_LIST_INIT(prereqlist);
2674 ISC_LIST_INIT(updatelist);
2675
2676 switch(ddns_cb->state) {
2677 case DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_NXDOMAIN:
2678 result = build_fwd_add1(ddns_cb, dataspace, pname, uname);
2679 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2680 goto cleanup;
2681 }
2682 ISC_LIST_APPEND(prereqlist, pname, link);
2683 break;
2684
2685 case DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_YXDHCID:
2686 result = build_fwd_add2(ddns_cb, dataspace, pname, uname);
2687 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2688 goto cleanup;
2689 }
2690
2691 /* If we are doing conflict detection we have entries
2692 * in the pname list and we need to attach it to the
2693 * prereqlist */
2694
2695 if (ddns_cb->flags & DDNS_CONFLICT_DETECTION) {
2696 ISC_LIST_APPEND(prereqlist, pname, link);
2697 }
2698
2699 break;
2700
2701 case DDNS_STATE_DSMM_FW_ADD3: {
2702 /* We should only be here if we're doing DSMM */
2703 builder_func_t builder;
2704 if (ddns_cb->flags & DDNS_OTHER_GUARD_IS_DYNAMIC) {
2705 builder = build_dsmm_fwd_add3_other;
2706 } else {
2707 builder = build_dsmm_fwd_add3;
2708 }
2709
2710 result = (*builder)(ddns_cb, dataspace, pname, uname);
2711 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2712 goto cleanup;
2713 }
2714
2715 ISC_LIST_APPEND(prereqlist, pname, link);
2716 break;
2717 }
2718
2719 case DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_YXDHCID:
2720 result = build_fwd_rem1(ddns_cb, dataspace, pname, uname);
2721 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2722 goto cleanup;
2723 }
2724 ISC_LIST_APPEND(prereqlist, pname, link);
2725 break;
2726
2727 case DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_NXRR: {
2728 builder_func_t builder;
2729
2730 if (ddns_cb->flags & DDNS_DUAL_STACK_MIXED_MODE) {
2731 builder = build_fwd_rem2_dsmm;
2732 } else {
2733 builder = build_fwd_rem2;
2734 }
2735
2736 result = (*builder)(ddns_cb, dataspace, pname, uname);
2737 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2738 goto cleanup; }
2739 ISC_LIST_APPEND(prereqlist, pname, link);
2740 break;
2741 }
2742
2743 case DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_DSMM_OTHER: {
2744 result = build_fwd_rem2_dsmm_other(ddns_cb, dataspace,
2745 pname, uname);
2746 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2747 goto cleanup; }
2748 ISC_LIST_APPEND(prereqlist, pname, link);
2749 break;
2750 }
2751
2752 default:
2753 log_error("ddns_modify_fwd: Invalid state: %d", ddns_cb->state);
2754 result = DHCP_R_INVALIDARG;
2755 goto cleanup;
2756 break;
2757 }
2758
2759 /*
2760 * We always have an update list but may not have a prereqlist
2761 * if we are doing conflict override.
2762 */
2763 ISC_LIST_APPEND(updatelist, uname, link);
2764
2765 /* send the message, cleanup and return the result */
2766 result = ddns_update(dhcp_gbl_ctx.dnsclient,
2767 dns_rdataclass_in, zname,
2768 &prereqlist, &updatelist,
2769 zlist, tsec_key,
2770 DNS_CLIENTRESOPT_ALLOWRUN,
2771 dhcp_gbl_ctx.task,
2772 ddns_interlude,
2773 (void *)ddns_cb,
2774 &ddns_cb->transaction);
2775 if (result == ISC_R_FAMILYNOSUPPORT) {
2776 log_info("Unable to perform DDNS update, "
2777 "address family not supported");
2778 }
2779
2780#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
2781 print_dns_status(DDNS_PRINT_OUTBOUND, ddns_cb, result);
2782#endif
2783
2784 cleanup:
2785#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
2786 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2787 log_info("DDNS: %s(%d): error in ddns_modify_fwd %s for %p",
2788 file, line, isc_result_totext(result), ddns_cb);
2789 }
2790#endif
2791
2792 if (dataspace != NULL) {
2793 isc_mem_put(dhcp_gbl_ctx.mctx, dataspace,
2794 sizeof(*dataspace) * 4);
2795 }
2796 return(result);
2797}
2798
2799
2800isc_result_t
2801ddns_modify_ptr(dhcp_ddns_cb_t *ddns_cb, const char *file, int line)
2802{
2803 isc_result_t result;
2804 dns_tsec_t *tsec_key = NULL;
2805 unsigned char *ptrname;
2806 dhcp_ddns_data_t *dataspace = NULL;
2807 dns_namelist_t updatelist;
2808 dns_fixedname_t zname0, uname0;
2809 dns_name_t *zname = NULL, *uname;
2810 isc_sockaddrlist_t *zlist = NULL;
2811 unsigned char buf[256];
2812 int buflen;
2813
2814#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
2815 log_info("DDNS: ddns_modify_ptr");
2816#endif
2817
2818 /* Creates client context if we need to */
2819 result = dns_client_init();
2820 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2821 return result;
2822 }
2823
2824 /*
2825 * Try to lookup the zone in the zone cache. As with the forward
2826 * case it's okay if we don't have one, the DNS code will try to
2827 * find something also if we succeed we will need to dereference
2828 * the zone later. Unlike with the forward case we assume we won't
2829 * have a pre-existing zone.
2830 */
2831 result = find_cached_zone(ddns_cb, FIND_REVERSE);
2832
2833#if defined (DNS_ZONE_LOOKUP)
2834 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND) {
2835 /*
2836 * We didn't find a cached zone, see if we can
2837 * can find a nameserver and create a zone.
2838 */
2839 if (find_zone_start(ddns_cb, FIND_REVERSE) == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2840 /*
2841 * We have started the process to find a zone
2842 * queue the ddns_cb for processing after we
2843 * create the zone
2844 */
2845 /* sar - not yet implemented, currently we just
2846 * arrange for things to get cleaned up
2847 */
2848 goto cleanup;
2849 }
2850 }
2851#endif
2852 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2853 goto cleanup;
2854
2855
2856 if ((result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) &&
2857 !(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(ddns_cb->zone_server_list))) {
2858 /* Set up the zone name for use by DNS */
2859 result = dhcp_isc_name(ddns_cb->zone_name, &zname0, &zname);
2860 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2861 log_error("Unable to build name for zone for "
2862 "fwd update: %s %s",
2863 ddns_cb->zone_name,
2864 isc_result_totext(result));
2865 goto cleanup;
2866 }
2867 /* If we have any addresses get them */
2868 if (!(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(ddns_cb->zone_server_list))) {
2869 zlist = &ddns_cb->zone_server_list;
2870 }
2871
2872 /*
2873 * If we now have a zone try to get the key, NULL is okay,
2874 * having a key but not a tsec is odd so we warn.
2875 */
2876 /*sar*/
2877 /* should we do the warning if we have a key but no tsec? */
2878 if ((ddns_cb->zone != NULL) && (ddns_cb->zone->key != NULL)) {
2879 tsec_key = ddns_cb->zone->key->tsec_key;
2880 if (tsec_key == NULL) {
2881 log_error("No tsec for use with key %s",
2882 ddns_cb->zone->key->name);
2883 }
2884 }
2885 }
2886
2887 /* We must have a name for the update list */
2888 /* Get a pointer to the ptrname to make things easier. */
2889 ptrname = (unsigned char *)ddns_cb->rev_name.data;
2890
2891 if ((result = dhcp_isc_name(ptrname, &uname0, &uname))
2892 != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2893 log_error("Unable to build name for fwd update: %s %s",
2894 ptrname, isc_result_totext(result));
2895 goto cleanup;
2896 }
2897
2898 /*
2899 * Allocate the various isc dns library structures we may require.
2900 * Allocating one blob avoids being halfway through the process
2901 * and being unable to allocate as well as making the free easy.
2902 */
2903 dataspace = isc_mem_get(dhcp_gbl_ctx.mctx, sizeof(*dataspace) * 2);
2904 if (dataspace == NULL) {
2905 log_error("Unable to allocate memory for fwd update");
2906 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
2907 goto cleanup;
2908 }
2909
2910 ISC_LIST_INIT(updatelist);
2911
2912 /*
2913 * Construct the update list
2914 * We always delete what's currently there
2915 * Delete PTR RR.
2916 */
2917 result = make_dns_dataset(dns_rdataclass_any, dns_rdatatype_ptr,
2918 &dataspace[0], NULL, 0, 0);
2919 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2920 goto cleanup;
2921 }
2922 ISC_LIST_APPEND(uname->list, &dataspace[0].rdataset, link);
2923
2924 /*
2925 * If we are updating the pointer we then add the new one
2926 * Add PTR RR.
2927 */
2928 if (ddns_cb->state == DDNS_STATE_ADD_PTR) {
2929 /*
2930 * Need to convert pointer into on the wire representation
2931 */
2932 if (MRns_name_pton((char *)ddns_cb->fwd_name.data,
2933 buf, 256) == -1) {
2934 goto cleanup;
2935 }
2936 buflen = 0;
2937 while (buf[buflen] != 0) {
2938 buflen += buf[buflen] + 1;
2939 }
2940 buflen++;
2941
2942 result = make_dns_dataset(dns_rdataclass_in,
2943 dns_rdatatype_ptr,
2944 &dataspace[1],
2945 buf, buflen, ddns_cb->ttl);
2946 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2947 goto cleanup;
2948 }
2949 ISC_LIST_APPEND(uname->list, &dataspace[1].rdataset, link);
2950 }
2951
2952 ISC_LIST_APPEND(updatelist, uname, link);
2953
2954 /*sar*/
2955 /*
2956 * for now I'll cleanup the dataset immediately, it would be
2957 * more efficient to keep it around in case the signaturure failed
2958 * and we wanted to retry it.
2959 */
2960 /* send the message, cleanup and return the result */
2961 result = ddns_update((dns_client_t *)dhcp_gbl_ctx.dnsclient,
2962 dns_rdataclass_in, zname,
2963 NULL, &updatelist,
2964 zlist, tsec_key,
2965 DNS_CLIENTRESOPT_ALLOWRUN,
2966 dhcp_gbl_ctx.task,
2967 ddns_interlude, (void *)ddns_cb,
2968 &ddns_cb->transaction);
2969 if (result == ISC_R_FAMILYNOSUPPORT) {
2970 log_info("Unable to perform DDNS update, "
2971 "address family not supported");
2972 }
2973
2974#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
2975 print_dns_status(DDNS_PRINT_OUTBOUND, ddns_cb, result);
2976#endif
2977
2978 cleanup:
2979#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
2980 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2981 log_info("DDNS: %s(%d): error in ddns_modify_ptr %s for %p",
2982 file, line, isc_result_totext(result), ddns_cb);
2983 }
2984#endif
2985
2986 if (dataspace != NULL) {
2987 isc_mem_put(dhcp_gbl_ctx.mctx, dataspace,
2988 sizeof(*dataspace) * 2);
2989 }
2990 return(result);
2991}
2992
2993void
2994ddns_cancel(dhcp_ddns_cb_t *ddns_cb, const char *file, int line) {
2995 ddns_cb->flags |= DDNS_ABORT;
2996 if (ddns_cb->transaction != NULL) {
2997 dns_client_cancelupdate((dns_clientupdatetrans_t *)
2998 ddns_cb->transaction);
2999 }
3000 ddns_cb->lease = NULL;
3001
3002#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
3003 log_info("DDNS: %s(%d): cancelling transaction for %p",
3004 file, line, ddns_cb);
3005#endif
3006}
3007
3008#endif /* NSUPDATE */
3009
3010HASH_FUNCTIONS (dns_zone, const char *, struct dns_zone, dns_zone_hash_t,
3011 dns_zone_reference, dns_zone_dereference, do_case_hash)
3012
3013#if defined (NSUPDATE)
3014#if defined (DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES)
3015/* Defines a type for creating list of labeled integers */
3016typedef struct {
3017 int val;
3018 char *name;
3019} LabeledInt;
3020
3021char*
3022ddns_state_name(int state) {
3023 static LabeledInt ints[] = {
3024 { DDNS_STATE_CLEANUP, "DDNS_STATE_CLEANUP" },
3025 { DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_NXDOMAIN, "DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_NXDOMAIN" },
3026 { DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_YXDHCID, "DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_YXDHCID" },
3027 { DDNS_STATE_ADD_PTR, "DDNS_STATE_ADD_PTR" },
3028 { DDNS_STATE_DSMM_FW_ADD3, "DDNS_STATE_DSMM_FW_ADD3" },
3029 { DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_YXDHCID, "DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_YXDHCID" },
3030 { DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_NXRR, "DDNS_STATE_FW_NXRR" },
3031 { DDNS_STATE_REM_PTR, "DDNS_STATE_REM_PTR" },
3032 { -1, "unknown" },
3033 };
3034
3035 LabeledInt* li = ints;
3036 while (li->val != -1 && li->val != state) {
3037 ++li;
3038 }
3039
3040 return (li->name);
3041}
3042
3043int
3044add_nstring(char **orig, char *max, char *add, int add_len) {
3045 if (*orig && (*orig + add_len < max)) {
3046 strncpy(*orig, add, add_len);
3047 *orig += add_len;
3048 **orig = 0;
3049 return (0);
3050 }
3051
3052 return (-1);
3053}
3054
3055int
3056add_string(char **orig, char *max, char *add) {
3057 return (add_nstring(orig, max, add, strlen(add)));
3058}
3059
3060/*
3061 * direction outbound (messages to the dns server)
3062 * inbound (messages from the dns server)
3063 * ddns_cb is the control block associated with the message
3064 * result is the result from the dns code. For outbound calls
3065 * it is from the call to pass the message to the dns library.
3066 * For inbound calls it is from the event returned by the library.
3067 *
3068 * For outbound messages we print whatever we think is interesting
3069 * from the control block.
3070 * For inbound messages we only print the transaction id pointer
3071 * and the result and expect that the user will match them up as
3072 * necessary. Note well: the transaction information is opaque to
3073 * us so we simply print the pointer to it. This should be sufficient
3074 * to match requests and replys in a short sequence but is awkward
3075 * when trying to use it for longer sequences.
3076 */
3077void
3078print_dns_status (int direction,
3079 struct dhcp_ddns_cb *ddns_cb,
3080 isc_result_t result)
3081{
3082 char obuf[1024];
3083 char *s = obuf, *end = &obuf[sizeof(obuf)-2];
3084 char *en;
3085 const char *result_str;
3086 char ddns_address[
3087 sizeof("ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:255.255.255.255")];
3088
3089 if (direction == DDNS_PRINT_INBOUND) {
3090 log_info("DDNS reply: id ptr %p, result: %s",
3091 ddns_cb->transaction, isc_result_totext(result));
3092 return;
3093 }
3094
3095 /*
3096 * To avoid having to figure out if any of the strings
3097 * aren't NULL terminated, just 0 the whole string
3098 */
3099 memset(obuf, 0, 1024);
3100
3101 en = "DDNS request: id ptr ";
3102 if (s + strlen(en) + 16 < end) {
3103 sprintf(s, "%s%p", en, ddns_cb->transaction);
3104 s += strlen(s);
3105 } else {
3106 goto bailout;
3107 }
3108
3109 en = ddns_state_name(ddns_cb->state);
3110
3111 switch (ddns_cb->state) {
3112 case DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_NXDOMAIN:
3113 case DDNS_STATE_ADD_FW_YXDHCID:
3114 case DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_YXDHCID:
3115 case DDNS_STATE_REM_FW_NXRR:
3116 case DDNS_STATE_DSMM_FW_ADD3:
3117 strcpy(ddns_address, piaddr(ddns_cb->address));
3118 if (s + strlen(en) + strlen(ddns_address) +
3119 ddns_cb->fwd_name.len + 7 < end) {
3120 sprintf(s, " %s %s for %.*s", en, ddns_address,
3121 ddns_cb->fwd_name.len,
3122 ddns_cb->fwd_name.data);
3123 s += strlen(s);
3124 } else {
3125 goto bailout;
3126 }
3127 break;
3128
3129 case DDNS_STATE_ADD_PTR:
3130 case DDNS_STATE_REM_PTR:
3131 if (s + strlen(en) + ddns_cb->fwd_name.len +
3132 ddns_cb->rev_name.len + 7 < end) {
3133 sprintf(s, " %s %.*s for %.*s", en,
3134 ddns_cb->fwd_name.len,
3135 ddns_cb->fwd_name.data,
3136 ddns_cb->rev_name.len,
3137 ddns_cb->rev_name.data);
3138 s += strlen(s);
3139 } else {
3140 goto bailout;
3141 }
3142 break;
3143
3144 case DDNS_STATE_CLEANUP:
3145 default:
3146 if (s + strlen(en) < end) {
3147 sprintf(s, "%s", en);
3148 s += strlen(s);
3149 } else {
3150 goto bailout;
3151 }
3152 break;
3153 }
3154
3155 en = " zone: ";
3156 if (s + strlen(en) + strlen((char *)ddns_cb->zone_name) < end) {
3157 sprintf(s, "%s%s", en, ddns_cb->zone_name);
3158 s += strlen(s);
3159 } else {
3160 goto bailout;
3161 }
3162
3163 /* @todo replace with format that matches bind9 zone file */
3164 if (ddns_cb->dhcid_class == dns_rdatatype_dhcid) {
3165 char *idbuf = NULL;
3166 if (add_string(&s, end, "dhcid: [")) {
3167 goto bailout;
3168 }
3169
3170 idbuf = buf_to_hex(ddns_cb->dhcid.data,
3171 ddns_cb->dhcid.len, MDL);
3172 if (idbuf) {
3173 int ret = add_string(&s, end, idbuf);
3174 dfree(idbuf, MDL);
3175 if (!ret) {
3176 goto bailout;
3177 }
3178 }
3179
3180 if (add_string(&s, end, "]")) {
3181 goto bailout;
3182 }
3183 } else {
3184 /* 1st byte of a txt dhcid is length, so we skip printing it
3185 * In the event it's empty, we end up not adding anything */
3186 int skip_length_byte = (ddns_cb->dhcid.len > 0 ? 1 : 0);
3187 if (add_string (&s, end, "txt: [") ||
3188 add_nstring (&s, end,
3189 (char *)ddns_cb->dhcid.data + skip_length_byte,
3190 ddns_cb->dhcid.len - skip_length_byte) ||
3191 add_string (&s, end, "]")) {
3192 goto bailout;
3193 }
3194 }
3195
3196 en = " ttl: ";
3197 if (s + strlen(en) + 10 < end) {
3198 sprintf(s, "%s%ld", en, ddns_cb->ttl);
3199 s += strlen(s);
3200 } else {
3201 goto bailout;
3202 }
3203
3204 en = " result: ";
3205 result_str = isc_result_totext(result);
3206 if (s + strlen(en) + strlen(result_str) < end) {
3207 sprintf(s, "%s%s", en, result_str);
3208 s += strlen(s);
3209 } else {
3210 goto bailout;
3211 }
3212
3213 bailout:
3214 /*
3215 * We either finished building the string or ran out
3216 * of space, print whatever we have in case it is useful
3217 */
3218 log_info("%s", obuf);
3219
3220 return;
3221}
3222#endif /* DEBUG_DNS_UPDATES */
3223#endif /* NSUPDATE */
